00406 #endif
00407 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00408 #define CVMX_BTS_TP_MUX_SEL CVMX_BTS_TP_MUX_SEL_FUNC()
00409 static inline uint64_t CVMX_BTS_TP_MUX_SEL_FUNC(void)
00410 {
00411     if (!(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX)))
00412         cvmx_warn("CVMX_BTS_TP_MUX_SEL not supported on this chip\n");
00413     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800B6000480ull);
00414 }
00415 #else
00416 #define CVMX_BTS_TP_MUX_SEL (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800B6000480ull))
00417 #endif
00418

00463 /**
00464  * cvmx_bts_cg_ctl
00465  *
00466  * This register controls the BFN and clocks produced by the clock generator.
00467  *
00468  */
00469 union cvmx_bts_cg_ctl {
00470     uint64_t u64;
00471     struct cvmx_bts_cg_ctl_s {
00472 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00473     uint64_t sw_1pps_delay                : 32; /**< Delay between PD_1PPS and CG_1PPS in 30.72MHz cycles. */
00474     uint64_t reserved_28_31               : 4;
00475     uint64_t sw_bfn                       : 12; /**< BFN sequence start number. This value is only loaded by hardware when
00476                                                          SW_BFN_2MSB_VLD=1 or SW_BFN_10LSB_VLD=1. */
00477     uint64_t smcell                       : 1;  /**< Small cell mode:
00478                                                          0 = Bypass clock generator and output RFP and BFN directly from
00479                                                          external pins (i.e., BPHY_RFP and BPHY_BFN).
00480                                                          1 = Output RFP and BFN produced by clock generator. */
00481     uint64_t reserved_5_14                : 10;
00482     uint64_t sw_bfn_2msb_vld              : 1;  /**< Set by software to indicate SW_BFN bits [11:10] are valid. The BFN
00483                                                          value will be updated at the next SW_1PPS pulse. Hardware will
00484                                                          automatically clear this bit once the value has been updated. */
00485     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00486     uint64_t sw_bfn_10lsb_vld             : 1;  /**< Set by software to indicate SW_BFN bits [9:0] are valid. The BFN
00487                                                          value will be updated at the next SW_1PPS pulse. Hardware will
00488                                                          automatically clear this bit once the value has been updated. */
00489 #else
00490     uint64_t sw_bfn_10lsb_vld             : 1;
00491     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00492     uint64_t sw_bfn_2msb_vld              : 1;
00493     uint64_t reserved_5_14                : 10;
00494     uint64_t smcell                       : 1;
00495     uint64_t sw_bfn                       : 12;
00496     uint64_t reserved_28_31               : 4;
00497     uint64_t sw_1pps_delay                : 32;
00498 #endif
00499     } s;
00500     struct cvmx_bts_cg_ctl_s              cnf75xx;
00501 };

00553 /**
00554  * cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1
00555  *
00556  * This register configures the clock divider used to generate a 1PPS signal
00557  * from external reference clock 0 (i.e., EXTREF0_CLK).
00558  */
00559 union cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1 {
00560     uint64_t u64;
00561     struct cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1_s {
00562 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00563     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32; /**< Divider start position. When a new value is written to
00564                                                          [DIVIDER_START_POS], the counter will reset to 0 the next time the
00565                                                          counter value is equal to [DIVIDER_START_POS]. Subsequently, the counter
00566                                                          will reset to 0 when the counter is equal to [DIVIDER_TC].
00567                                                          Writing [DIVIDER_START_POS] effectively applies a positive phase shift
00568                                                          of [DIVIDER_START_POS]+1 cycles to the 1PPS signal.
00569                                                          Note that a phase shift is only applied when this value changes, thus
00570                                                          it might be necessary to write this field to zero before applying a
00571                                                          new phase shift. */
00572     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32; /**< Divider counter terminal count value.
00573                                                          When BTS_EXT_REF0_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=0, this field should be
00574                                                          set to the clock frequency minus one.
00575                                                          When BTS_EXT_REF0_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=1, this field should be
00576                                                          set to half the clock frequency minus one. */
00577 #else
00578     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32;
00579     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32;
00580 #endif
00581     } s;
00582     struct cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1_s   cnf75xx;
00583 };
00584 typedef union cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1 cvmx_bts_ext_ref0_div_cfg1_t;

00742 /**
00743  * cvmx_bts_grfe_1pps_en
00744  *
00745  * This register enables the GNSS_1PPS signal and specifies the frame and
00746  * sample number of the initial 1PPS pulse.
00747  */
00748 union cvmx_bts_grfe_1pps_en {
00749     uint64_t u64;
00750     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_1pps_en_s {
00751 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00752     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable 1PPS. The first 1PPS pulse will be generated 2
00753                                                          GNSS_CLK cycles after receiving sample [START_SMPL_NUM] in frame
00754                                                          [START_FRM_NUM]. This bit must be cleared before writing the other
00755                                                          fields in this register. */
00756     uint64_t reserved_40_62               : 23;
00757     uint64_t start_frm_num                : 24; /**< Start frame number for 1PPS generation. The first pulse will be
00758                                                          generated 2 GNSS clock cycles after [START_FRM_NUM],[START_SMPL_NUM], and
00759                                                          in some cases this might require setting [START_FRM_NUM] to one less
00760                                                          than the actual frame number where the first 1PPS pulse will occur. */
00761     uint64_t start_smpl_num               : 16; /**< Start sample number for 1PPS generation. Note that the first 1PPS
00762                                                          pulse will actually be generated two GNSS clock cycles later (i.e.,
00763                                                          at [START_SMPL_NUM]+2). */
00764 #else
00765     uint64_t start_smpl_num               : 16;
00766     uint64_t start_frm_num                : 24;
00767     uint64_t reserved_40_62               : 23;
00768     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00769 #endif
00770     } s;
00771     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_1pps_en_s        cnf75xx;
00772 };

00775 /**
00776  * cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0
00777  *
00778  * This register configures the RXIQ sampling and weight accumulator for the
00779  * BTS GRFE.
00780  */
00781 union cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0 {
00782     uint64_t u64;
00783     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0_s {
00784 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00785     uint64_t on                           : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable the GRFE. The BTS_GRFE_CFG0-2 registers must be
00786                                                          programmed before setting this bit. Similarly, this bit must be
00787                                                          cleared before changing any values in the BTS_GRFE_CFG0-2 registers. */
00788     uint64_t reserved_16_62               : 47;
00789     uint64_t rs                           : 4;  /**< Right shift amount for the weighted accumulator. */
00790     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
00791     uint64_t ds_factor                    : 2;  /**< Down-sampling factor.
00792                                                          0x0 = 1 sample down-sampling (i.e., no down-sampling).
00793                                                          0x1 = 2 sample down-sampling.
00794                                                          0x2 = 4 sample down-sampling.
00795                                                          0x3 = 8 sample down-sampling. */
00796     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00797     uint64_t iq_mode                      : 3;  /**< Format for incoming I/Q data from GNSS RF front-end:
00798                                                          0x0 = 1 bit signed 2's complement, complex value.
00799                                                          0x1 = 2 bit signed 2's complement, complex value.
00800                                                          0x2 = 3 bit signed 2's complement, real value only.
00801                                                          0x3 = 1 bit sign/magnitude, complex value.
00802                                                          0x4 = 2 bit sign/magnitude, complex value.
00803                                                          0x5 = 3 bit sign/magnitude, real value only.
00804                                                          0x6 = Reserved.
00805                                                          0x7 = Reserved. */
00806     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00807     uint64_t dlatch_edge                  : 1;  /**< Select whether I/Q values are sampled on rising or falling edge of
00808                                                          GNSS_CLK:
00809                                                          0 = Rising edge.
00810                                                          1 = Falling edge. */
00811 #else
00812     uint64_t dlatch_edge                  : 1;
00813     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00814     uint64_t iq_mode                      : 3;
00815     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00816     uint64_t ds_factor                    : 2;
00817     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
00818     uint64_t rs                           : 4;
00819     uint64_t reserved_16_62               : 47;
00820     uint64_t on                           : 1;
00821 #endif
00822     } s;
00823     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0_s           cnf75xx;
00824 };
00825 typedef union cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0 cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg0_t;

00827 /**

00832  */
00833 union cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg1 {

00838                                                          signed, 8-bit weights. w(0) is stored in bits [7..0], w(1) is stored
00839                                                          in bits [15..8], etc. */
00840 #else

00847 
00848 /**
00849  * cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2
00850  *
00851  * This register configures the output format for the BTS GRFE sample framer,
00852  * and the size and location of the circular buffer used to write the GNSS
00853  * samples.
00854  *
00855  * Frames are written to the circular buffer at increasing addresses starting
00856  * at [BASE_ADDR]. The number of frames that can be written in the buffer
00857  * before wrapping around to [BASE_ADDR] is specified via [SIZE_IN_FRM].
00858  *
00859  * Note that the size of each frame depends on [IQ_PACK_MODE] and
00860  * BTS_GRFE_CFG0[DS_FACTOR], as follows:
00861  *
00862  * _ For 8-bit samples, each frame is 32768/(2^DS_FACTOR) bytes.
00863  *
00864  * _ For 16-bit samples, each frame is 65536/(2^DS_FACTOR) bytes.
00865  */
00866 union cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2 {
00867     uint64_t u64;
00868     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2_s {
00869 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00870     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00871     uint64_t iq_pack_mode                 : 2;  /**< I/Q packing mode of GPS frame in memory:
00872                                                          0x0 = 8 bit, little-endian.
00873                                                          0x1 = 16 bit, little-endian.
00874                                                          0x2 = 8 bit, big-endian.
00875                                                          0x3 = 16 bit, big-endian. */
00876     uint64_t reserved_58_59               : 2;
00877     uint64_t size_in_frm                  : 10; /**< The size of the frame buffer in number of frames. */
00878     uint64_t int_threshold                : 8;  /**< Interrupt coalescing threshold. The GRFE_FRMR_RDY interrupt is
00879                                                          triggered each time the GRFE framer has written INT_THRSESHOLD frames.
00880                                                          Setting to 0x0 disables the interrupt. */
00881     uint64_t base_addr                    : 33; /**< Bits[39:7] of the base address of frame buffer. The buffer must be
00882                                                          128-bit aligned (i.e, bits [6:0] are always 0). */
00883     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00884 #else
00885     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00886     uint64_t base_addr                    : 33;
00887     uint64_t int_threshold                : 8;
00888     uint64_t size_in_frm                  : 10;
00889     uint64_t reserved_58_59               : 2;
00890     uint64_t iq_pack_mode                 : 2;
00891     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00892 #endif
00893     } s;
00894     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2_s           cnf75xx;
00895 };
00896 typedef union cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2 cvmx_bts_grfe_cfg2_t;
00897 
00898 /**
00899  * cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr
00900  */
00901 union cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr {
00902     uint64_t u64;
00903     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr_s {
00904 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00905     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable the frame and sample counters. */
00906     uint64_t reserved_48_62               : 15;
00907     uint64_t smpl_cntr_max                : 16; /**< The sample counter runs from 0 to [SMPL_CNTR_MAX] every 1 ms. Typically this value
00908                                                          should be set to the number of cycles per millisecond minus 1. ([SMPL_CNTR_MAX] + 1) must
00909                                                          be
00910                                                          multiple of 8 to support GRFE down-sampling. Default value is 0x3FEF
00911                                                          (16367) for 16.386 MHz clock. */
00912     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
00913     uint64_t frm_num                      : 24; /**< Current value of the frame counter. */
00914 #else
00915     uint64_t frm_num                      : 24;
00916     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
00917     uint64_t smpl_cntr_max                : 16;
00918     uint64_t reserved_48_62               : 15;
00919     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00920 #endif
00921     } s;
00922     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr_s           cnf75xx;
00923 };
00924 typedef union cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr cvmx_bts_grfe_cntr_t;
00925 
00926 /**
00927  * cvmx_bts_grfe_sta
00928  */
00929 union cvmx_bts_grfe_sta {
00930     uint64_t u64;
00931     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_sta_s {
00932 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00933     uint64_t frames_stored                : 24; /**< The number of frames which have been committed to memory. This number
00934                                                          resets to zero when it rolls over and when BTS_GRFE_CFG0[ON] is
00935                                                          cleared.
00936                                                          If BTS_GRFE_CFG2[SIZE_IN_FRM] is a power of two, then the address of
00937                                                          the last valid frame can be calculated as:
00938                                                          BASE_ADDR + FRM_SIZE_IN_BYTES*(([FRAMES_STORED]-1)%SIZE_IN_FRM)
00939                                                          If BTS_GRFE_CFG2[SIZE_IN_FRM] is NOT a power of two, then software
00940                                                          must count how many times [FRAMES_STORED] has rolled-over to zero. Then
00941                                                          software can calculate the address of the last valid frame as:
00942                                                          BASE_ADDR+FRM_SIZE_IN_BYTES*(([FRAMES_STORED]-1+ROLL_OVERS*((2^24)%SIZE_IN_FRM)%SIZE_IN_FR
00943                                                          M)
00944                                                          Note that under continuous operation, [FRAMES_STORED] will roll-over
00945                                                          approximately every 4.66 hours. */
00946     uint64_t target_addr                  : 33; /**< Bits [39:7] of the address where the next GNSS frame will be written.
00947                                                          This value may be updated before the data from previous frames is
00948                                                          available in memory, so software should rely on the value in
00949                                                          [FRAMES_STORED] to ensure that it does not read memory before the writes
00950                                                          complete. This address resets to BTS_GRFE_CFG2[BASE_ADDR] when
00951                                                          BTS_GRFE_CFG0[ON] is toggled. */
00952     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00953 #else
00954     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00955     uint64_t target_addr                  : 33;
00956     uint64_t frames_stored                : 24;
00957 #endif
00958     } s;
00959     struct cvmx_bts_grfe_sta_s            cnf75xx;
00960 };
00961 typedef union cvmx_bts_grfe_sta cvmx_bts_grfe_sta_t;

01016 
01017 /**
01018  * cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0
01019  *
01020  * This register configures the clock divider used to generate the PD_1PPS
01021  * signal derived from the 30.72 MHz clock (BPHY_BFN_CLK). This signal is
01022  * used by the clock generation block to control RFP timing.
01023  *
01024  * This register configures the clock divder used to generate the
01025  * PD_3072M_1PPS signal derived from the 30.72 MHz clock (BPHY_BFN_CLK).
01026  *
01027  * When [FREE_RUN]=1, the initial alignment depends on when [DIVIDER_EN] is written
01028  * to 1, and the value in BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS].
01029  *
01030  * When [FREE_RUN]=0, the initial alignment will be
01031  * BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS]+4 cycles after the reference clock
01032  * selected by [REF_IN_SEL] (where cycles are counted in the 30.72 MHz clock).
01033  *
01034  * In both cases, after the initial pulse, subsequent 1PPS pulses are
01035  * generated at a constant period.
01036  */
01037 union cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0 {
01038     uint64_t u64;
01039     struct cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0_s {
01040 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01041     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01042     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;  /**< Select the reference 1PPS source:
01043                                                          0x0 = GNSS_1PPS.
01044                                                          0x1 = PTP_1PPS.
01045                                                          0x2 = SYNCE25M_1PPS.
01046                                                          0x3 = EXT_REF0_1PPS.
01047                                                          0x4 = EXT_REF1_1PPS.
01048                                                          0x5 = PD_3072_1PPS.
01049                                                          0x6-0x7 = Reserved. */
01050     uint64_t free_run                     : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable free running mode. In free running mode, all input
01051                                                          1PPS references are ignored. The initial start position is set by
01052                                                          BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS]. */
01053     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
01054     uint64_t clkout_5050_duty             : 1;  /**< Clock divider duty cycle:
01055                                                          0 = one cycle pulse (i.e., one 30.72 MHz cycle).
01056                                                          1 = 50/50 duty-cycle. */
01057     uint64_t divider_en                   : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable the clock divider. The divider counter is reset to 0 when
01058                                                          [DIVIDER_EN] is set to 0. */
01059 #else
01060     uint64_t divider_en                   : 1;
01061     uint64_t clkout_5050_duty             : 1;
01062     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
01063     uint64_t free_run                     : 1;
01064     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;
01065     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01066 #endif
01067     } s;
01068     struct cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0_s     cnf75xx;
01069 };
01070 typedef union cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0 cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg0_t;
01071 
01072 /**
01073  * cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1
01074  *
01075  * This register configures the clock divider used to generate the PD_1PPS
01076  * signal derived from the 30.72 MHz clock (BPHY_BFN_CLK). This signal is
01077  * used by the clock generation block to control RFP timing.
01078  *
01079  * When enabled, the divider counts from 0 to [DIVIDER_TC], and then resets
01080  * to 0. When it resets to zero, it either generates a single cycle pulse, or
01081  * flips the polarity of the output, depending on the setting of
01082  * BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY].
01083  */
01084 union cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1 {
01085     uint64_t u64;
01086     struct cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1_s {
01087 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01088     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32; /**< Divider start position. When a new value is written to
01089                                                          [DIVIDER_START_POS], the counter will reset to 0 the next time the
01090                                                          counter value is equal to [DIVIDER_START_POS]. Subsequently, the counter
01091                                                          will reset to 0 when the counter is equal to [DIVIDER_TC].
01092                                                          Writing [DIVIDER_START_POS] effectively applies a positive phase shift
01093                                                          of [DIVIDER_START_POS]+1 cycles to the 1PPS signal.
01094                                                          Note that a phase shift is only applied when this value changes, thus
01095                                                          it might be necessary to write this field to zero before applying a
01096                                                          new phase shift. */
01097     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32; /**< Divider counter terminal count value.
01098                                                          When BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=0, this field should be
01099                                                          set to the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0x1D4BFFF (307199999 for the 30.72
01100                                                          MHz clock.
01101                                                          When BTS_PD1PPS_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=1, this field should be
01102                                                          set to half the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0xEA5FFF (153599999 for the
01103                                                          30.72 MHz clock. */
01104 #else
01105     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32;
01106     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32;
01107 #endif
01108     } s;
01109     struct cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1_s     cnf75xx;
01110 };
01111 typedef union cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1 cvmx_bts_pd1pps_div_cfg1_t;
01112 
01113 /**
01114  * cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0
01115  *
01116  * This register configures the clock divider used to generate the
01117  * PD_3072M_1PPS signal derived from the 30.72 MHz clock (BPHY_BFN_CLK).
01118  *
01119  * When [FREE_RUN]=1, the initial alignment depends on when [DIVIDER_EN] is written
01120  * to 1, and the value in BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS].
01121  *
01122  * When [FREE_RUN]=0, the initial alignment will be
01123  * BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS]+4 cycles after the reference clock
01124  * selected by [REF_IN_SEL] (where cycles are counted in the 30.72 MHz clock).
01125  *
01126  * In both cases, after the initial pulse, subsequent 1PPS pulses are
01127  * generated at a constant period.
01128  */
01129 union cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0 {
01130     uint64_t u64;
01131     struct cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0_s {
01132 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01133     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01134     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;  /**< Select the reference 1PPS source:
01135                                                          0x0 = GNSS_1PPS.
01136                                                          0x1 = PTP_1PPS.
01137                                                          0x2 = SYNCE25M_1PPS.
01138                                                          0x3 = EXT_REF0_1PPS.
01139                                                          0x4 = EXT_REF1_1PPS.
01140                                                          0x5 = CG_1PPS.
01141                                                          0x6-0x7 = Reserved. */
01142     uint64_t free_run                     : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable free running mode. In free running mode, all input
01143                                                          1PPS references are ignored. The initial start position is set by
01144                                                          BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG1[DIVIDER_START_POS] and the timing of the write to
01145                                                          set [DIVIDER_EN]=1. */
01146     uint64_t clkout_inv                   : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to inverse the output polarity for the PD3072_1PPS
01147                                                          signal. */
01148     uint64_t clkout_5050_duty             : 1;  /**< Clock divider duty cycle:
01149                                                          0 = one cycle pulse (i.e., one 30.72 MHz cycle).
01150                                                          1 = 50/50 duty-cycle. */
01151     uint64_t divider_en                   : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable the clock divider. The divider counter is reset to 0 when
01152                                                          [DIVIDER_EN] is set to 0 and the clock output is disabled. */
01153 #else
01154     uint64_t divider_en                   : 1;
01155     uint64_t clkout_5050_duty             : 1;
01156     uint64_t clkout_inv                   : 1;
01157     uint64_t free_run                     : 1;
01158     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;
01159     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01160 #endif
01161     } s;
01162     struct cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0_s    cnf75xx;
01163 };
01164 typedef union cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0 cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg0_t;
01165 
01166 /**
01167  * cvmx_bts_pd3072m_div_cfg1
01168  *
01169  * This register configures the clock divder used to generate the PD3072_1PPS
01170  * signal derived from the 30.72 MHz clock (BPHY_BFN_CLK).
01171  *
01172  * When enabled, the divider counts from 0 to [DIVIDER_TC], and then resets
01173  * to 0. When it resets to zero, it either generates a single cycle pulse, or
01174  * flips the polarity of the output, depending on the setting of
01175  * BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY].

01182                                                          [DIVIDER_START_POS], the counter will reset to 0 the next time the
01183                                                          counter value is equal to [DIVIDER_START_POS]. Subsequently, the counter
01184                                                          will reset to 0 when the counter is equal to [DIVIDER_TC].
01185                                                          Writing [DIVIDER_START_POS] effectively applies a positive phase shift
01186                                                          of [DIVIDER_START_POS]+1 cycles to the 1PPS signal.
01187                                                          Note that a phase shift is only applied when this value changes, thus
01188                                                          it might be necessary to write this field to zero before applying a
01189                                                          new phase shift. */
01190     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32; /**< Divider counter terminal count value.
01191                                                          When BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=0, this field should be
01192                                                          set to the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0x1D4BFFF (30719999) for the 30.72
01193                                                          MHz clock.
01194                                                          When BTS_PD3072M_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=1, this field should be
01195                                                          set to half the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0xEA5FFF (15359999) for the

01225 /**
01226  * cvmx_bts_pd_slice#_ctl
01227  *
01228  * These registers control the operation of each PD bank.
01229  *
01230  * The PD bank must be disabled when changing any of these configuration
01231  * parameters (i.e., [ENABLE]=0). The PD bank should be enabled with a
01232  * separate register write after updating the other parameters (i.e., perform
01233  * one write to change the settings, and use a second write to enable the PD
01234  * bank).
01235  */
01236 union cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_ctl {
01237     uint64_t u64;
01238     struct cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_ctl_s {
01239 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01240     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01241     uint64_t mea_clk_sel                  : 2;  /**< Measurement clock select:
01242                                                          0x0 = 491 MHz clock, both edges.
01243                                                          0x1 = 491 MHz clock, rising edge only.
01244                                                          0x2, 0x3 = SCLK, rising edge only.
01245                                                          Refer to BTS_PLL_CTL for how to configure the 491 MHz clock. */
01246     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;  /**< Reference 1pps source select.
01247                                                          0x0 = GNSS_1PPS.
01248                                                          0x1 = PTP_1PPS.
01249                                                          0x2 = SyncE 25 MHz 1PPS.
01250                                                          0x3 = External reference 0 1PPS.
01251                                                          0x4 = External reference 1 1PPS.
01252                                                          0x5 = PD_3072_1PPS.
01253                                                          0x6 = CG_1PPS.
01254                                                          0x7 = Reserved. */
01255     uint64_t loop_in_sel                  : 3;  /**< Loop 1pps source select.
01256                                                          0x0 = GNSS_1PPS.
01257                                                          0x1 = PTP_1PPS.
01258                                                          0x2 = SyncE 25 MHz 1PPS.
01259                                                          0x3 = External reference 0 1PPS.
01260                                                          0x4 = External reference 1 1PPS.
01261                                                          0x5 = PD_3072_1PPS.
01262                                                          0x6 = CG_1PPS.
01263                                                          0x7 = Reserved. */
01264     uint64_t enable                       : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to enable the PD bank. */
01265 #else
01266     uint64_t enable                       : 1;
01267     uint64_t loop_in_sel                  : 3;
01268     uint64_t ref_in_sel                   : 3;
01269     uint64_t mea_clk_sel                  : 2;
01270     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01271 #endif
01272     } s;
01273     struct cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_ctl_s       cnf75xx;
01274 };
01275 typedef union cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_ctl cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_ctl_t;
01276 
01277 /**
01278  * cvmx_bts_pd_slice#_status
01279  *
01280  * This register reports the calculated phase difference for each PD bank.
01281  *
01282  * BTS triggers a BTS_PDBANK(0..5)_DONE interrupt each time the PD bank
01283  * completes a measurement and updates this status register.
01284  */
01285 union cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_status {
01286     uint64_t u64;
01287     struct cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_status_s {
01288 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01289     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01290     uint64_t pd_result                    : 33; /**< The phase difference as a signed, two's complement value. A positive value indicates that
01291                                                          the REF clock is ahead of LOOP, and a negative value indicates that LOOP is ahead of REF.
01292                                                          The phase difference is measured based on the clock selected by
01293                                                          BTS_PD_SLICE(0..5)_CTL[MEA_CLK_SEL], and can represent either SCLK cycles, 491 MHz cycles,
01294                                                          or 982 MHz cycles (1.0183 ns). */
01295 #else
01296     uint64_t pd_result                    : 33;
01297     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01298 #endif
01299     } s;
01300     struct cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_status_s    cnf75xx;
01301 };
01302 typedef union cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_status cvmx_bts_pd_slicex_status_t;
01303 
01304 /**
01305  * cvmx_bts_pll_ctl
01306  *
01307  * This register controls the sample clock frequency into PD Bank slices.
01308  * The following sequence is the PLL-bringup sequence:
01309  *   1. Write [RESET_N]=0 and [DIV_RESET]=1.
01310  *   2. Set [CLKF] and [PS_EN].
01311  *   3. Wait 128 reference-clock cycles.
01312  *   4. Write [RESET_N]=1.
01313  *   5. Wait 1152 reference-clock cycles.
01314  *   6. Write [DIV_RESET]=0.
01315  *   7. Wait 10 reference-clock cycles before using the PLL clock out.
01316  */
01317 union cvmx_bts_pll_ctl {
01318     uint64_t u64;
01319     struct cvmx_bts_pll_ctl_s {
01320 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01321     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
01322     uint64_t alt_ref_clk_sel              : 2;  /**< Alternate reference clock select:
01323                                                          0x0 = DLM6 ref clock.
01324                                                          0x1 = DLM7 ref clock.
01325                                                          0x2 or 0x3 = DLM8 ref clock. */
01326     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;  /**< Set to 1 to bypass PLL. In PLL bypass mode, the PLL clock out is BPHY_BFN_CLK (30.72 MHz). */
01327     uint64_t ref_clk_sel                  : 1;  /**< Reference clock select:
01328                                                          0 = 122.88MHz (alternate reference clock selected by ALT_REF_CLK_SEL).
01329                                                          1 = 30.72MHz (BPHY_BFN_CLK). */
01330     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;  /**< Postscalar divider reset. */
01331     uint64_t ps_en                        : 4;  /**< PLL postscalar divide ratio. Determines the network clock speed.
01332                                                          0x0 = divide BTS PLL by 1.
01333                                                          0x1 = divide BTS PLL by 2.
01334                                                          0x2 = divide BTS PLL by 3.
01335                                                          0x3 = divide BTS PLL by 4.
01336                                                          0x4 = divide BTS PLL by 5.
01337                                                          0x5 = divide BTS PLL by 6.
01338                                                          0x6 = divide BTS PLL by 7.
01339                                                          0x7 = divide BTS PLL by 8.
01340                                                          0x8 = divide BTS PLL by 10.
01341                                                          0x9 = divide BTS PLL by 12.
01342                                                          0xA-0xF = Reserved.
01343                                                          PS_EN is not used when DIV_RESET = 1. See CLKF for supported settings. */
01344     uint64_t reserved_8_17                : 10;
01345     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< PLL reset. */
01346     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;  /**< PLL multiplier. PLL out frequency = PLL in clk(MHz) * ([CLKF]+1) / ([PS_EN]+1)
01347                                                          To generate a 491MHz clock from  a 30.72 MHz reference (i.e., when
01348                                                          REF_CLK_SEL=1), set CLKF to 0x7f and PS_EN to 0x7. This results in an
01349                                                          overall 16x multplier.
01350                                                          To generate 491MHz clock from a 122.88 MHz reference (i.e., when
01351                                                          REF_CLK_SEL=0), set CLKF to 0x1f and PS_EN to 0x7. This results in an
01352                                                          overall 4x multiplier.
01353                                                          Note that other settings are not supported and may result in undefined
01354                                                          behavior. */
01355 #else
01356     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;
01357     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
01358     uint64_t reserved_8_17                : 10;
01359     uint64_t ps_en                        : 4;
01360     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;
01361     uint64_t ref_clk_sel                  : 1;
01362     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;
01363     uint64_t alt_ref_clk_sel              : 2;
01364     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
01365 #endif
01366     } s;
01367     struct cvmx_bts_pll_ctl_s             cnf75xx;
01368 };
01369 typedef union cvmx_bts_pll_ctl cvmx_bts_pll_ctl_t;

01452  * cvmx_bts_synce_25m_div_cfg1
01453  */
01454 union cvmx_bts_synce_25m_div_cfg1 {
01455     uint64_t u64;
01456     struct cvmx_bts_synce_25m_div_cfg1_s {
01457 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01458     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32; /**< Divider start position. When a new value is written to
01459                                                          [DIVIDER_START_POS], the counter will reset to 0 the next time the
01460                                                          counter value is equal to [DIVIDER_START_POS]. Subsequently, the counter
01461                                                          will reset to 0 when the counter is equal to [DIVIDER_TC].
01462                                                          Writing [DIVIDER_START_POS] effectively applies a positive phase shift
01463                                                          of [DIVIDER_START_POS]+1 cycles to the 1PPS signal.
01464                                                          Note that a phase shift is only applied when this value changes, thus
01465                                                          it might be necessary to write this field to zero before applying a
01466                                                          new phase shift. */
01467     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32; /**< Divider counter terminal count value.
01468                                                          When BTS_SYNCE_25M_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=0, this field should be
01469                                                          set to the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0x17D783F (24999999) for the 25
01470                                                          MHz clock.
01471                                                          When BTS_SYNCE_25M_DIV_CFG0[CLKOUT_5050_DUTY]=1, this field should be
01472                                                          set to half of the clock frequency minus one, i.e., 0xBEBC1F (12499999) for the 25
01473                                                          MHz clock. */
01474 #else
01475     uint64_t divider_tc                   : 32;
01476     uint64_t divider_start_pos            : 32;
01477 #endif
01478     } s;
01479     struct cvmx_bts_synce_25m_div_cfg1_s  cnf75xx;
